answer:
Tony Romo is a former American football quarterback who played in the National Football League (NFL) for 14 seasons, primarily with the Dallas Cowboys. He was a four-time Pro Bowl selection and led the Cowboys to the playoffs four times, including an appearance in Super Bowl XLV.

After retiring from playing, Romo became a sports commentator for CBS Sports. He is known for his insightful analysis and his ability to connect with viewers.
